A year after the war, Saddam Hussein mocked President Bush from Baghdad and claimed victory: "It was George H.W. Bush with his own will who decided to stop the fighting. Nobody had asked him to do so.' Seizing on that appearance of presidential weakness, Bill Clinton campaigned that year against President Bush - and beat him- chiding George H.W. Bush for not putting Saddam Hussein and his acolytes on trial for war crimes. " Bill Clinton would prove no more effective than George H.W. Bush in removing Saddam Hussein , Geoffrey Wawro noted.
